name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas reported the fewest new confirmed Covid cases since I see them being tracked in March of last year.  The 7-day positivity rate dropped to a new all-time low of 2.78 %.  Covid hospitalizations dropped to a one-year low.  Fatalities fell to 3rd lowest in 14 months.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas reported the fewest new confirmed Covid cases in 14 months.  The 7-day positivity rate dropped to a new all-time low of 2.82 %.  Covid hospitalizations dropped to a one-year low.  Texas has been open 100% with no mask requirements.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas surpassed 22 million Covid vaccine shots administered.  Almost 80% of seniors have received a shot.  We set an all-time record low for the 7-day Covid positivity rate: 3.11%  Hospitalizations continue to decline--now at a 51-week low.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: “Gov. Abbott was right about reopening, masks.”  “Public health scolds should apologize.”  Texas is open 100% with no masks required—and we’ve never been doing better in putting Covid behind us.   https://t.co/HilScfro2a

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas Covid numbers continue to improve.  Today we reported the fewest Covid hospitalizations since the first week of June last year.  The 7-day positivity rate is 3.41%. It has been below 4% for 11 consecutive days.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas reported the lowest 7-day positivity rate since reporting began: 3.21%. It has been below 4% for an entire week.  We also reported a new 11-month low in hospitalizations.  In the past 13 months, only 2 days had fewer confirmed Covid cases than today.  Great trends!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas recorded the fewest Covid-related hospitalizations in more than 11 months.  We also recorded the lowest 7-day Covid positivity rate since we began keeping the data. It's 3.66% today. It has been below 4% for almost a week.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas reported:  * A new 13 month low in the number of Covid positive cases  * A new all-time low for the 7-day Covid positivity rate--now showing 3.74%  * A new 11 month low in Covid hospitalizations.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas reported:  * 0 Covid related deaths--the only time that's happened since data was tracked in March, 2020.  * the fewest Covid cases in over 13 months  * the lowest 7-day Covid positivity rate ever  * the lowest Covid hospitalizations in 11 months.  Thanks, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas reported the second lowest Covid hospitalizations in 11 months. The lowest was earlier this week.  The 7-day positivity rate has been below 5% for 12 consecutive days with today being the lowest at 4.24%.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The spike in COVID-19 cases and deaths in India is tragic.   Cecilia and I ask all Texans to join us in praying for the people of India as they battle this terrible virus.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Two months ago Texas opened 100%.  And today...  * We had the fewest Covid hospitalizations in 11 months  * We reported the fewest new Covid cases in 11 months  * We tied for the 2nd fewest fatalities (3) in more than a year  * the 7-day positivity rate hit a new low of 4.16%

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Since Texas opened 100% 2 months ago (tomorrow)  * Covid hospitalizations are the lowest in almost 11 months  * 5 consecutive days with fewer than 2,000 Covid cases  * Covid positivity rate below 5% for 6 straight days for the 1st time in forever  * fatalities down more than 2/3

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 19 million Covid vaccinations.  More than 75% of seniors have received a shot.  More than half of all Texans over 15 have received a shot.  The 7-day Covid positivity rate has been below 5% for 4 straight days.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The Texas economic comeback is on.   Texas is open 100%.   Jobs are growing rapidly and our economy is flourishing.   COVID cases and hospitalizations continue to decline.    https://t.co/PiF72JLnQb

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas reported the second lowest number of lab-confirmed Covid cases in almost 11 months.  We also reported another decline in Covid hospitalizations--now at a 10 1/2 month low.  Thanks, Texans, for containing the spread of Covid.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Covid hospitalizations continue to decline.  Today they were the lowest in more than 10 months.  More than 210,000 Texans got a Covid shot today.  Always voluntary, never forced, but highly recommended to reduce Covid.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 18 million Covid vaccine shots administered.  GREAT NEWS ->  Today Texas reported the fewest Covid hospitalizations in 10 months.  More than 75% of seniors have received a vaccine shot.  More than 60% of Texans age 50-64 have received a shot.  Great job!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas recorded the 2nd fewest fatalities related to Covid in 6 months. It's the 3rd lowest in 10 months.  Also, we've had consecutive days with the statewide Covid positivity rate below 5%.  Great job Texans.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas had the fewest Covid Hospitalizations in the last 10 months.  2 days this week were among the 4 lowest days in the last 10 months for the fewest number of new lab-based Covid positive cases.  The 7-day positivity rate has been below 6% for 42 straight days.  Great job

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 17 million vaccine shots just 4 days after passing 16 million.  We had the 2nd lowest number of Covid hospitalizations in 10 months.  About 75% of seniors have received a vaccine shot.  Shots are available to all Texans age 16 and older.  Always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 16 million vaccine shots, just 4 days after passing 15 million.  We had the 2nd lowest number of lab-confirmed Covid-positive cases in 10 months: 1,073.  The 7-day rolling Covid positivity rate was under 5%.  Hospitalizations were near lowest in 10 months.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 15 million Covid vaccine shots, just 5 days after passing 14 million.  282,336 Texans got a shot today.   More than 72% of Texas seniors & 55% of Texans age 50-64 have received a shot.  Always voluntary, but  recommended to prevent Covid.  Great job Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas surpassed 14 million Covid vaccine shots--just 2 days after passing 13 million.  We also set a new record number of Covid vaccines given to Texans in one day: 388,833.  We had the 2nd lowest Covid-related hospitalizations in 10 months.  Great job, Texans!

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas reported a 10-month low in the number of Texans testing positive for Covid.  We reported 3 Covid-related fatalities. That's the 2nd lowest in more than a year.  And hospitalizations decreased again to almost a 10-month low.  More than 250,000 Texans got a Covid shot.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today more than 192,000 Texans got a Covid shot.  More than 2/3 of Texans over 65 have received a shot & almost half of Texans 50-64 have gotten a shot.  That reduces potential future hospitalizations--which are at a 9-month low.  The 7-day Covid positivity rate fell below 5%.

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today, Texas surpassed 12 million total Covid shots--just 3 days after passing 11 million.  That included 265,571 Covid shots today.  We had the 2nd lowest number of Texans test positive since June 8.  Covid hospitalizations were the lowest since June 17th.  Great work Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas recorded a new record number of Covid vaccines given to Texans in one day: 359,810.  Also, we recorded a new 9-month low in Covid hospitalizations.  Thanks to all the healthcare providers who are helping achieve this success!

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: 240,162 Texans got a Covid shot today.  We surpassed 11 million total shots--just 5 days after passing 10 million.  Hospitalizations went down to a new 6 month low.   The 7-day Covid positivity rate has remained below 6% for the 9th day in a row.  Great work Texans!

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: 227,137 Texans got a Covid shot today.  With high vaccine volumes expected, we may set a record for Covid shots tomorrow.  The 7-day Covid positivity rate continues to stay around 5% and hospitalizations near 6-month lows.  Great job, Texans!  Vaccines are always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The 7-day Covid positivity rate reported today is 4.96%  Hospitalizations remained low & fatalities dropped to a 3 month low  Altogether Texas has 2 million vaccine shots to administer this week. Get one.  Shots are highly recommended to prevent getting Covid but always voluntary

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today the 7-day Covid positivity rate dropped to a new recorded low: 4.95%  Hospitalizations dropped to a 6 month low  This week we have 1 million 1st vaccines available  Everyone now qualifies for a shot. They are highly recommended to prevent getting Covid but always voluntary

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas hit an all-time recorded low for the 7-day Covid positivity rate: 5.27%.  It's been below 6% for 5 days & below 10% for an entire month.  Covid hospitalizations declined again--now at the lowest level since October 3rd.   Vaccinations continue to increase rapidly.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Today Texas recorded the lowest 7-day Covid positivity rate since that data began being calculated: 5.43%.  We also recorded the largest daily number of vaccines administered to Texans: 342,849.  More Texans getting vaccines will keep down the positivity rate.  Always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: The Covid positivity rate continues to plummet; now down to 5.9%. That is the lowest in almost 10 months.  Covid hospitalizations dropped below 4,000 for the first time in 5 months.  Most importantly, Covid related fatalities today are the lowest reported this year.

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: More than 225,000 Texans got a COVID vaccine shot today and well over 7 million shots have been given in Texas.  Hospitalizations are the lowest since mid-October.  The positivity rate is 6.64% -- the lowest since late Sept.  More than 52% of seniors have received a vaccine.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas is now expanding the COVID vaccine eligibility to include all Texans 50 and older--beginning March 15th.   Most seniors have already received a shot.  Seniors who have not received a shot & want one will still be prioritized.  Always voluntary.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: More than 220,000 Texans got a COVID vaccine shot today.  More than 51% of seniors have received a shot.  The positivity rate has dropped for 15 straight days & is now down to 6.64%.  Keep up the great work to crush COVID in Texas.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Covid hospitalizations declined again today  The positivity rate is the lowest since late September & has been on a downward trajectory for months.  The number of reported fatalities is the lowest in more than 2 months.  COVID has not gone away, but we can continue to crush it.

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Looks like ⁦@realDonaldTrump⁩ is making a swift recovery from COVID.   So many prayers answered.   https://t.co/VjN1774R0z

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Dallas leads the country in employees returning to the office.  Other Texas cities doing well too.  Texas will continue to lead in returning to work if we continue the effective strategies to slow the spread of COVID.  More announcements soon.   https://t.co/l6FIiYAq7f

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas has applied for a federal program that would give Texans who are out of work due to COVID an extra $300 in benefits per week.   If approved by the Federal Government - as expected - the benefits will be retroactively effective the week ending Aug. 1  https://t.co/qULq7z0l7K

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: How Houston Defied Doomsday COVID Predictions.  “I really do think that the mandatory wearing a face mask in public was the catalyst to get things turned around,” Harris Health CEO Dr. Porsa told National Review.   https://t.co/4jFVOKBH7r

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas nursing facilities are receiving $1.1 billion for quality improvements.  This will focus on things like infectious disease control to make our nursing homes safer from COVID-19.   https://t.co/dbIONWLSvE

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas is delivering on its commitment to provide care for Rio Grande Valley residents.   Today, McAllen Convention Center started to take first patients with COVID-19.   A similar facility is opening in Harlingen.    #RGV   https://t.co/V3wqqVAu81

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Victoria is another COVID hotspot where we are surging medical resources.   Working with the federal government, medical staff from the U.S. Department of Defense Medical team are in Victoria to provide DeTar hospital with needed assistance.   https://t.co/AHVT5b5SpI

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: I had the opportunity to visit with Starr County Judge Eloy Very to learn what he needs to respond to COVID.  Texas immediately provided the requested medical equipment and hospital beds.  We will continue to surge supplies to help the #RGV.   https://t.co/3gT9GFXyD9

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: 14 Dallas family members get COVID-19 after virus denier’s party, 1 dead and another on life support.  COVID is still spreading rapidly across Texas.  It must be taken seriously.   https://t.co/ZpmnWPERvB

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: RIP Herman Cain.   Herman Cain Dies After Being Hospitalized for Covid-19.   https://t.co/fltY3DkmQe

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas is providing hospital beds, medical staff, supplies and equipment to convert the McAllen Convention Center into a healthcare facility to help Rio Grande Valley leaders combat COVID.  We thank McAllen for providing the location & #RGV local leaders for their collaboration.

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Dip in COVID cases suggests mask order paying off.  But a decrease in daily COVID cases shouldn’t be cause to relax mask wearing & other precautions says Lamar University public health expert.  Instead it just shows that these precautions are working.   https://t.co/ktNCIjUNim

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas has some of the leading universities in the world helping us combat COVID.   The federal government has approved $265 million to manufacture coronavirus vaccine at Texas A&M facility.   ⁦@TAMU⁩ #GigEm   https://t.co/USzSjdIrix

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas manufacturing sector's recovery continues in July.  "The past two months have marked a significant turnaround"  We can create more jobs while also using safe practices to contain COVID spread.  We can do both: save lives & support livelihoods.   https://t.co/zG7FACG8FN

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texans are doing great—taking action needed to slow the spread of COVID.   Let’s continue to beat these other states to crush it.   COVID hasn’t disappeared.   We must continue using masks, keeping safe distances & staying home if possible.  https://t.co/pNkCKuPNUp

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Great job Galveston to slow the spread of COVID.   You did it by wearing masks, reducing the size of gatherings, staying home when possible & good distancing practices.   COVID can’t spread if you don’t give it a chance to transmit.   Don’t let it return.  Keep crushing it.  https://t.co/ybZMgEXlxC

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Houston hospitalizations are trending down.   It’s a start—aided by Texans wearing masks and staying at home when possible.   COVID hasn’t gone away.   But we won’t have to shut down if everyone will continue using safe distancing practices.  https://t.co/sEnlserr0t

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Texas is surging medical teams to Harlingen, Del Rio, Eagle Pass, Rio Grande City & other areas hit hard by COVID-19.  We are providing ventilators & PPE to Cameron and Hidalgo Counties, including over three million surgical masks.   https://t.co/t0rpMc73gg

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: A 30-year-old attended a “COVID party” in Texas to see if COVID was real.   He got it.   He died.   https://t.co/tn9Ff1NPDc

name: Greg Abbott

name: Greg Abbott
tweet: Throwing Texans in jail whose biz's shut down through no fault of their own is wrong.  I am eliminating jail for violating an order, retroactive to April 2, superseding local orders.  Criminals shouldn’t be released to prevent COVID-19 just to put business owners in their place.
